content.description: Low Ball. Traverse ledge as far as you can. Top out when you're all traversed out. Kinda seems like some BS Active Climbing would make up as a comp route. Bat hang if you're a real one.
content.protection: don't slip or eat dirt at low velocity

content.description: Easy ladder climb with large holds to nice perch up top. street shoes can fit on the large ledges. don't slip on the dust or fall on the metal railing.
content.protection: concrete and metal railing below. spotter
content.location: Over South doorway on Smith hall. (between Smith hall and Lloyd hall) Near bike racks and sheltered outdoor seating.

content.description: Wide chimney to pillar ledge, high foot and top-out. Careful about fall height or people. Walk-down inside staircase if balcony door is open. Otherwise un-fun downclimb.
content.location: Front balcony on North Lawn Hall. One of them is less exposed to the main road, Hackberry.

content.description: Pick a side. Climb starting low on the arch, use brick crimps to make your way to the upside-down gray trapezoids to finish. campus-able crux with street shoes. careful about landing if using heel hooks
content.protection: Flat concrete below. may want pad
content.location: Archways in the Shelby Hall courtyard.

content.description: Start matched on low undercling (3 feet up, in middle area of rock face. Top out straight up.
content.protection: up to you, grass is soft.
content.location: On the rock monument straight in front of Gorgas library. Problem is on the library side.

content.description: The center areas of campus with classrooms, a variety of buildings, and busy sidewalks on weekdays. Don't go pissing anyone off.
